text: The 1972 Paris–Tours was the 66th edition of the Paris–Tours cycle race and was held on 1 October 1972. The race started in Paris and finished in Tours. The race was won by Noël Vantyghem. ==General classification== {| |Final general classification {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col" | Rank ! scope="col" | Rider ! scope="col" | Time |- | style="text-align:center;" | 1 | | style="text-align:right;" | |- | style="text-align:center;" | 2 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 3 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 4 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 7" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 5 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 1' 47" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 6 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 1' 47" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 7 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 1' 47" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 8 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 1' 47" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 9 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 1' 47" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 10 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 1' 47" |} |} ==References== Category:1972 in French sport 1972 Category:1972 Super Prestige Pernod
